derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stēpel, of Germanic origin; related to steep

entry.def: A steeple is a tall pointed structure on top of the tower of a church.

means.word_mean: 1. a tall tower that forms the superstructure of a building (usually a church or temple) and that tapers to a point at the top
